technology: There were no technical difficulties experienced by the participant.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some negative affect regarding current mask mandates and the virus being similar to the flu.
past_neg_affect: The participant expresses negative affect about his son not having a graduation ceremony and having to do zoom classes.
communal_orientation: The participant is engaged in the conversation, shares personal experiences, and responds to the conversation partner's statements.
engagement: The participant is very engaged in the conversation, sharing personal stories and opinions.
defensiveness: The participant is not very defensive, but does express his own opinions and beliefs.

questions.transcript: So I guess guess that's about where I'm at on that.
what was going through your mind when vaccines were rolled out?
Something similar happened for you. Were you all right?
How many boosters have you received?
Now that you've got them did you find that they've changed your behaviors?
Kind of I know, especially with the vaccine kind of things opening back up to the change. Your behaviors and comfortability. Now, kind of your perception around covid or.
For instance, you think you're gonna get the new overcrowded booster?
Or do you think you'll try a yearly Covid booster shot if it rolls out?

similarity_statements.transcript: So, and I want to say similar.

vaccine_importance: The participant believes vaccines are very important, stating that they helped open things up and trusts the science community.
booster_importance: The participant will probably get a yearly COVID-19 booster shot.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates cognitive complexity by considering different perspectives, acknowledging the speed of vaccine development, and weighing the risks and benefits.
general_notes: The participant shares personal experiences and feelings about COVID-19, vaccines, and boosters. He acknowledges the negative impact of COVID-19 on his son's education and expresses concern for his father's health. He is generally supportive of vaccines and boosters but also respects the decisions of those who choose not to get them.
